citation.article-title: Uliginosibacterium gangwonense gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from a wetland, Yongneup, in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Uliginosibacterium (Ul.i.gi.no.si.bac.te′ri.um. L. adj. uligonosus wet, moist, marshy; L. neut. n. bacterium a rod; N.L. neut. n. Uliginosibacterium a rod isolated from peat).
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0 and summed feature 3; C18 : 1ω7c, C17 : 0 cyclo, C12 : 0, C14 : 0 and C12 : 0 3-OH are present as minor components.
On the basis of the results of 16S rRNA gene sequence comparisons, the genus belongs to the family Rhodocyclaceae, class Betaproteobacteria.
The type species is Uliginosibacterium gangwonense.
